title: Director, National Center for Supercomputing Applications, Grainger Distinguished Chair in Engineering, Siebel School of Computing and Data Science
biography: William D. Gropp is the Director of the National Center for Supercomputing Applications and holds the Grainger Distinguished Chair in Engineering at the Siebel School of Computing and Data Science, University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. He is a Council Member for Section T - Information, Computing, and Communication at the American Association for the Advancement of Science and serves on the Computing Research Association (CRA) board and the Computing Community Consortium (CCC) executive committee. His research focuses on high performance computing, scalable numerical algorithms, and programming models for large-scale scientific computing.

researchStatement: My research focuses on the use of high performance computing to solve problems that are too hard for other techniques. I have concentrated in two areas: the development of scalable numerical algorithms for partial differential equations (PDEs), especially for the linear systems that arise from approximations to PDEs, and the development of programming models and systems for expressing and implementing highly scalable applications.
